reviews.text: Stayed for one week as a guest of a condo owner. Traveled in August with my family of 4. Booked a 2 room condo on the second floor of the Banyan building. Was worried about the lack of air conditioning, as another reviewer mentioned, this place was built to use those trade winds. If you opened the vents and windows up, winds whipped through that unit. The unit was huge, jacuzzi bathtub was a bonus. Had a full kitchen with appliances, pots, dishes, washer and dryer in the hallway, two full bathrooms and a TV in each bedroom and the living room. The Banyan pool was great, had a fun "natural" feel with a waterfall, rocks and plants growing all around. Lawai beach is directly across the small road and has amazing snorkeling. Went almost every morning, before heading out for our days activities. Ate on the lanai for breakfast and dinner, watching the sun rise and set. The hotel is set up so many of their rooms have an ocean view. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Kids enjoyed the movie rentals and the mini golf. Internet access was sketchy, but you're in Hawaii - unplug. Hotel is easy to get to and short drives to most sites from Wiamea Canyon to Kapaa. This condo was so comfortable and kid friendly, it really made our vacation, too bad their website doesn't do it justice.
reviews.title: Wonderful condo, amazing snorkeling

likes.liked: — Close to beach with great snorkeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My new husband and i were fortunate to receive a vacation package to The Lawaii Beach Resort as a wedding gift. We stayed at the resort for an entire week at the Coral building.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would have to say that the vacation was the best of my life and I owe a lot of it to the Lawaii Beach Resort. The room we stayed in was neat, clean and very spacious. We even had an extra bedroom with twin beds that were never used, making us wish (kind of) that we had some of our children along to fill the space. Granted it was a fleeting thought, but nevertheless... Many reviews I had read about the resort before I left made me question the cleanliness and service provided at the resort but I would have to say that I never experienced any of it. All the service providers we came across were always cheerful and went out of their way to be helpful.
reviews.title: The best Kauai Vacation!

likes.liked: — right across the street from the best snorkeling around.

reviews.text: The grounds were very well maintained as I noticed were many of the resorts in the area. My husband loved the tiki torches scattered around the property and decided he was going to attempt to place permanent ones on our patio at home. Our room was on the main floor of the building so we did not get a complete unobscured view of the ocean, but it's location was nice in the fact that the pool was only steps away. I enjoyed my morning swims after snuggling on a lounge chair to read almost as much as the nightly soak in the jacuzzi. Some nights there would be a gentle rain as we were in the hot tub and pool yet the stars were shining bright. I loved to float on my back as the warm rain hit my face and gaze at the constellations.
reviews.title: Liked the resort!

reviews.text: I had also read in earlier reviews how some people were irritated by all the chickens running around the resort and the island. I have to say that I thought they were charming and they were a wonderful piece of local color that I thoroughly enjoyed. I was chasing handsome roosters around the whole trip with my camara in hand.
reviews.title: The true story!

reviews.text: We made our reservation through Suite`Paradise They were extremely helpful, and we got a good package deal. I was a little concerned about the condo as the pictures don't do it justice. This place is beautiful. Really beautiful. Our condo was directly in front of one of the mist amazing surf beaches I've ever seen. The condo was spotless, updated, fully stocked with anything one could possibly need. All we had to get were the groceries. The condo was also very large and so comfortable. No AC, which would not be needed as the wonderful fans with the continuous ocean breezes kept us comfortable. The staff was extremely pleasant.and helpful. Snorkeling is great. Lots of wonderful places to see, tons of great activities, and lots of great restaurants. We went to the Tidepools at the Hyatt one night for dinner. Wow, what a great meal. I highly suggest walking around the pool area at the Hyatt, amazing! I have been to Hawaii numerous times and several other islands and I will definately come back here again. This is a great place.
reviews.title: Fabulous Place

reviews.text: Stayed in Unit 1417 Mar 22-28, 2008
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised with Condo 1417

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ocean view 1 bedroom with king bed & sofa bed
reviews.title: Beautiful Location, Great People

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me my husband our 2 teen boys 16 & 14
reviews.title: We purchased a timeshare at Lawai Beach Resort before leaving Kauaii

likes.liked: — lovely apartment, resort location, size and staff

reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

likes.liked: — The view from the lanai and the location
likes.disliked: — The fact that they are building right behind the resort and it will be noisy for awhile.

reviews.title: Perfect Stay in a wonderful Location
reviews.text: I wrote this while I was staying at Lawai Beach Resort and added something every day(well almost). Check-in was super easy, the resort is in excellent condition and the rooms are spacious and very large. They have a big screen TVs(although we did not even turn it on), lots of cooking utensils, nice clean large bathrooms and a staff so friendly I felt like I was family(the good kind). The active construction near the resort is completed so you cannot hear it however the dust barrier is still up. We stayed in the Coral building which has a parking garage behind it which is convenient because we could drive up to our floor. We did have an ocean view but it was because we were on the 3rd floor. I do not think the 1st and 2nd floors have an ocean view although I am not sure. Our 1 bed room condo could have easily accommodated 4 – 2 on the sleeper sofa and 2 in the bedroom(there were only 2 of us). If you want an unobstructed view of the Ocean get a room in the Banyan or Alli building and at least on the 2nd floor or higher. The workout facility was nice, free wireless in 2 public areas it would have been nice to have wireless in the rooms even if we had to pay for it, the room internet access is via Ethernet cable. In the morning depending on how late you want o sleep the Coral building can be a little noisey, about 930am is when people start getting up and the noise bounces off the parking structure. Usually we had the windows open which is probably why we could hear the noise – equally loud were the waves from across the street so we can’t complain.

reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations - Almost
reviews.text: If you are looking for the “touristy” Hawaiian experience I would not recommend a condo, we have been to Hawaii many times and sometimes we feel like going to a hotel and being pampered(Hyatt); on other occasions I want a little more privacy, more space and the ability to cook my own food(breakfast, lunch or dinner). We bought fish from the Koloa Fish Market twice, cooked it ourselves and it was wonderful, they gave us suggestions on how to cook it and even helped us with a shopping list. The Lawai Beach Resort is next to a very small beach with excellent snorkeling right off the shore and a very good restaurant called the Beach House. A very short car ride away is the wonderful Poipu Beach perfect for everyone from adults to little kids.

reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
reviews.text: Restaurants:

reviews.title: Loved everything about this resort
reviews.text: Café Portifino in the Marriot

reviews.title: Nice location, Motel 6 type bathrooms and furnishings
reviews.text: Italian food was good but not spectacular, the service was a little slow and we had to return the bottle of wine as the finish was off. (when I pay $120 a bottle for a wine I know and love I expect it to be perfect). We selected a different bottle of average quality and it was drinkable. The dessert was fantastic. I would not got back to this restaurant.

My husband and I arrived at Lawai Beach Resort as the 2nd week stay of our 18 day vacation. We were traveling with my parents and another couple. We arrived at 1PM and were told that our room was not ready. We were able to check our belongings with the bell staff and ventured out for some shopping. The resort is very centrally located being within a few miles of all of the major restaurants (Roy's, Tidepools, etc). We returned at 4 PM and were able to check in. My parents arrived a bit later and they realized upon check-in that we were given the wrong room as we were supposed to have two bathrooms in our unit (they had booked the unit through our timeshare). Our original room was not too impressive - in building 1 (I believe...it's a bit fuzzy now) on the first floor with a walkout to the pool. It was dark with a very small living room. Bathroom was small and claustrophobic. The whole place was tiny and dark....I wanted to go back to our other resort when I walked in. The 2nd bedroom has a perfect set-up for kids as it is two twin beds; however, not as ideal for two couples sharing a room. My parents went to speak to the front desk and they were incredibly unhelpful about the mix-up - letting them know that they had no other rooms and we were going to have to deal with it until the next day. The other couple traveling with us had received a gorgeous unit in the middle building - it was an owners unit they had been upgraded to. Owners units are DEFINITELY the place to stay in this resort as they have washer/dryers, upgraded TV's, and so much more room than the average unit.
reviews.title: Awesome resort on the South Shore!

reviews.text: The next day, my parents spoke to a young woman who could not have been more polite or helpful. She explained that she would help to find another room and would try to make the switch as soon as possible. She called our room less than an hour later and found a 4th floor room (much more desirable as you have an amazing ocean view) to switch us to. This was an owners unit, but one of the middle ones that people (even the owners) wait years on a waiting list to get. I don't know how we got so lucky. The unit was easily over 1200 sq ft, with a huge kitchen, dining room, large living room and a double balcony - the master bedroom had a balcony and the living room did too. There were two bathrooms...again the problem with the twin beds, but what can you do? Simply the most unbelievable unit as it was so huge and what an incredible view!!!
reviews.title: Everything we were looking for

reviews.text: The grounds of the Lawai beach resort were really clean and well-kept. There are three pools and hot tubs which made it seem not crowded even though the resort was full or very close to full. The beach is literally across the street and had the most amazing snorkeling on the entire island. My dad is a big scuba diver and he only took one scuba trip as the snokeling was better than even the scuba elsewhere! Bring your own fins (you'll need them as it is rocky), mask & snorkel.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a runner and was training for a half marathon at the time - it's a great run up to Spouting Horn and definitely walkable (about 1.5 mi) with some very cute vendors with great deals on pearls, etc. You can also run to town and they had a decent fitness center although it was really hot inside. The mini golf course was closed due to renovation when we were there. Don't miss eating at the Beach House across the street from the resort. It was probably the best meal we had on the entire trip...make reservations or you won't get in! Fantastic place for a cocktail and to watch the sunset (and Green Flash!) as well. Internet was an outrageous rip-off to have in the rooms....but you could get it for free in the lobby.
reviews.title: Perfect condo for repeat Poipu visitors!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the Lawai Beach Resort is probably hit or miss depending on the room you get and who you are traveling with. If you can get an owners unit or get upgraded, this place is the best place you will ever stay at. If you are in one of the smaller units...good luck...just don't ever be in your room - after all, you're in Kauai!!!
reviews.title: Great South Kauai Location
